feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Daily Wage Formula
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings intentionally overrides the formula configured in leave policy for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it is not active. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied for daily wage calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms. Users cannot easily understand why formulas are greyed out or how payroll settings supersede leave policy configurations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. Manual alignment is required, and there is no automatic formula inheritance or synchronization.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were calculated based on outdated salary configurations instead of the most recent salary setup, resulting in incorrect payroll deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change. | Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for leap years (specifically 2024), resulting in an inaccurate total service period and lower gratuity amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing potential underpayment of employee benefits.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product lacks dynamic leap year handling in service period computations for gratuity calculations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: Daily wage calculation for pro-rated amounts produces consistently incorrect results, showing amounts less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals. The calculation formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but results in systematic undercalculation across all employee departures.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Decimal precision error in pro-rated salary computations affects final settlement accuracy
known_issues.gap_statement: Product needs enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms for precise financial calculations

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation shows slight difference from manual calculation. Calculation involves splitting service duration into different rate periods (first 5 years at 21 days/year, subsequent years at 30 days/year) with daily wage prorated for partial years.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation requires complex service duration splitting and prorated daily wage calculation
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential complexity in handling precise gratuity calculations for employees with mixed service duration rates

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Not Considering Leap Year Extra Day
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently account for the extra day in a leap year (February 29th), potentially causing minor discrepancies in service duration calculation. The system calculated 912 days, while the client manually calculated 913 days by including the leap year day.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Methodology Nuances
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The system uses specific methodologies for calculating service duration, including leap year adjustments and day counting that may differ from manual calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation logic is complex and not transparently communicated, potentially leading to misunderstandings about how partial years and leap years are processed.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic, including worked examples of service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Days Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform calculates one extra day in job tenure (622 vs 623 days), causing slight variations in gratuity calculation. Daily wage is computed using a fixed 30-day divisor, which may not match all client expectations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Days worked calculation includes potential extra day, impacting precise gratuity computation
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of flexibility in daily wage and days worked calculation methodology

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. The daily wage is divided according to a fixed policy setting (potentially 30 days) rather than actual calendar days (31 days).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations that may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in explaining how leave salary calculations are performed, including daily rate divisor configurations

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Monthly leave salary accruals vary due to changing working days per month
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation mismatches. The client expects a consistent daily wage formula of (Basic salary + allowances / 30.42 days), but the system uses separate configurations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations are configured independently and may use different divisors.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method that consistently applies across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Salary proration depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not match traditional calendar day expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation logic does not handle future departure dates correctly during payroll processing
known_issues.gap_statement: The daily wage calculator lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Modification
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes out of sync between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically recalculate daily wage deductions when public holiday configurations change after leave request creation.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The platform displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. The backend calculation remains mathematically correct, but the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. While the backend calculation remains accurate, the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy settings for unpaid leave deductions. This results in calculations using gross salary instead of basic salary, contrary to policy-level configurations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Incorrectly Displayed
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display logic does not preserve the initially calculated rate from the leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need a consistent daily rate display mechanism that stores and shows the rate from the original leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days per Month Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated as: 365 (Days yearly) - 52 (Weekly off) = 313 / 12 = 26.08 working days
limitations.impact: Requires manual adjustments for variations in actual worked days

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Take Precedence Over Leave Policy
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll settings for daily wage calculator automatically override leave policy formulas for unpaid leave calculations. The leave policy formula becomes inactive and is displayed as greyed out.
limitations.impact: Users must configure daily wage calculations in payroll settings to ensure correct unpaid leave deductions

limitations.title: Salary Config Dependency in Leave Deduction
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deduction calculations are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential payroll calculation inaccuracies if salary configurations are updated after leave requests are created

limitations.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Counting
limitations.limitation_statement: System defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize 366 days in leap years during service period calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of end of service gratuity for employees with service spanning leap years

limitations.title: Systematic Decimal Precision Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently produce amounts less than expected due to decimal handling issues
limitations.impact: Potential financial discrepancies in employee end of service settlements

limitations.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Constraint
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, preventing prorated inclusion for mid-month departures
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month cannot automatically include current month's leave balance in End of Service settlement

limitations.title: Service Duration Calculation Methodology
limitations.limitation_statement: The system divides total service days by 365 to calculate years of service, with potential ambiguity around leap year days and departure date counting
limitations.impact: Potential minor variations in gratuity calculation depending on day counting method

limitations.title: Nuanced Handling of Incomplete Service Years
limitations.limitation_statement: The system calculates service years differently for periods above 5 years, using specific day-counting methods that may not align with manual expectations.
limitations.impact: Potential discrepancies in gratuity calculations for employees with service periods spanning multiple years

limitations.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of daily wage calculation for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform's daily wage calculation is constrained by predefined policy settings, preventing easy modification of divisor (days used for calculation)
limitations.impact: Users cannot override standard calculation method to account for different month lengths

limitations.title: Leave Encashment Daily Wage Calculation Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculator uses working days as the basis for leave encashment, which causes monthly variations in accrual calculations
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary amounts differ month-to-month due to varying working day counts

limitations.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration use separate daily wage configurations that cannot be automatically aligned without manual intervention.
limitations.impact: Potential calculation discrepancies and inconsistent salary prorations

limitations.title: Daily Wage Proration Based on Work Week
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Proration may differ from traditional calendar day calculations depending on work week setup

limitations.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly for departure dates in the past, not for future departure dates
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling in Leave Transactions
limitations.limitation_statement: The system does not automatically clean up or reconcile payroll deductions when leave requests are modified, deleted, or have their status changed.
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention to remove.

limitations.title: Lack of Real-Time Module Communication
limitations.limitation_statement: Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to Payroll module at the time of calculation, preventing accurate synchronization.
limitations.impact: Incorrect salary deductions when public holidays are modified after leave request creation

limitations.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Salary Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for calculating daily wage, not standard calendar days
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts may not precisely match expected monthly salary

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations are based on the actual calendar days in a month, with specific handling for months with varying day counts (e.g., February in leap years).
limitations.impact: Ensures accurate unpaid leave deductions by using the precise number of calendar days for each month

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inability to automatically prorate salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Current system lacks built-in automation for attendance-based salary calculations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking, managed separately for each employee

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inconsistent daily wage formula display between leave policy and payroll settings
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Payroll settings are designed to take precedence over leave policy configurations for unpaid leave calculations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify and configure daily wage calculator in payroll settings first; understand that leave policy formula will be overridden

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect unpaid leave deduction amount
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Deduction calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the leave request and create it again if the deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy in gratuity amount calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for leap years
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify and adjust gratuity calculation to account for 366 days in leap years

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: End of Service calculations show slightly lower amounts than expected
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Decimal precision error in daily wage calculation formula (basic + allowances / 30)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Escalate to development team for precise calculation fix

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Leave balance not automatically included for mid-month departure
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Monthly accrual policy prevents automatic prorating of leave days

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between system-calculated and manually edited gratuity amount
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System calculates gratuity based on predefined logic, but allows manual editing by users

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Difference between manual and system gratuity calculations

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Differences in daily wage and days worked calculation

claims_to_validate.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Daily Wage Formula
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings intentionally overrides the formula configured in leave policy for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it is not active. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied for daily wage calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were calculated based on outdated salary configurations instead of the most recent salary setup, resulting in incorrect payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
claims_to_validate.statement: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for leap years (specifically 2024), resulting in an inaccurate total service period and lower gratuity amount.

claims_to_validate.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculation for pro-rated amounts produces consistently incorrect results, showing amounts less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals. The calculation formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but results in systematic undercalculation across all employee departures.

claims_to_validate.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
claims_to_validate.statement: System gratuity calculation shows slight difference from manual calculation. Calculation involves splitting service duration into different rate periods (first 5 years at 21 days/year, subsequent years at 30 days/year) with daily wage prorated for partial years.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Not Considering Leap Year Extra Day
claims_to_validate.statement: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently account for the extra day in a leap year (February 29th), potentially causing minor discrepancies in service duration calculation. The system calculated 912 days, while the client manually calculated 913 days by including the leap year day.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Methodology Nuances
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The system uses specific methodologies for calculating service duration, including leap year adjustments and day counting that may differ from manual calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Days Mismatch
claims_to_validate.statement: Platform calculates one extra day in job tenure (622 vs 623 days), causing slight variations in gratuity calculation. Daily wage is computed using a fixed 30-day divisor, which may not match all client expectations.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. The daily wage is divided according to a fixed policy setting (potentially 30 days) rather than actual calendar days (31 days).

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation mismatches. The client expects a consistent daily wage formula of (Basic salary + allowances / 30.42 days), but the system uses separate configurations.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Modification
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes out of sync between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. The backend calculation remains mathematically correct, but the frontend display creates potential user confusion.

claims_to_validate.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy settings for unpaid leave deductions. This results in calculations using gross salary instead of basic salary, contrary to policy-level configurations.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Incorrectly Displayed
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days per Month Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated as: 365 (Days yearly) - 52 (Weekly off) = 313 / 12 = 26.08 working days

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Take Precedence Over Leave Policy
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll settings for daily wage calculator automatically override leave policy formulas for unpaid leave calculations. The leave policy formula becomes inactive and is displayed as greyed out.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Config Dependency in Leave Deduction
claims_to_validate.statement: Unpaid leave deduction calculations are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Counting
claims_to_validate.statement: System defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize 366 days in leap years during service period calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Systematic Decimal Precision Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently produce amounts less than expected due to decimal handling issues

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Constraint
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, preventing prorated inclusion for mid-month departures

claims_to_validate.title: Service Duration Calculation Methodology
claims_to_validate.statement: The system divides total service days by 365 to calculate years of service, with potential ambiguity around leap year days and departure date counting

claims_to_validate.title: Nuanced Handling of Incomplete Service Years
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates service years differently for periods above 5 years, using specific day-counting methods that may not align with manual expectations.

claims_to_validate.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform's daily wage calculation is constrained by predefined policy settings, preventing easy modification of divisor (days used for calculation)

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Encashment Daily Wage Calculation Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculator uses working days as the basis for leave encashment, which causes monthly variations in accrual calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave salary and salary proration use separate daily wage configurations that cannot be automatically aligned without manual intervention.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Proration Based on Work Week
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration only works correctly for departure dates in the past, not for future departure dates

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling in Leave Transactions
claims_to_validate.statement: The system does not automatically clean up or reconcile payroll deductions when leave requests are modified, deleted, or have their status changed.

claims_to_validate.title: Lack of Real-Time Module Communication
claims_to_validate.statement: Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to Payroll module at the time of calculation, preventing accurate synchronization.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Salary Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for calculating daily wage, not standard calendar days

claims_to_validate.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations are based on the actual calendar days in a month, with specific handling for months with varying day counts (e.g., February in leap years).

claims_to_validate.statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
